lead_paragraph: Dr. Don Catlin, one of the world’s leading antidoping experts, is leaving the U.C.L.A. Olympic lab he founded to devote his time to creating better tests to catch drug cheats. Catlin has developed numerous tests to detect performance-enhancing drugs and helped expose hundreds of cheating athletes. Catlin, 68, said his newly created Anti-Doping Research Institute in Los Angeles would focus on improving tests for human growth hormone and the endurance enhancer EPO (erythropoietin).
